title: process_samples
description: A pipeline to analyse multiple multiomics samples.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

rna_layer.description: Input layer for the gene expression modality

prot_layer.description: Input layer for the antibody capture modality

gdo_layer.description: Input layer for the guide-derived oligonucleotide (GDO) data

output.help_text: Type: `file`, multiple: `False`, required, default: `"$id.$key.output.h5mu"`, direction: `output`, example: `"output.h5mu"`.

sample id options.title: Sample ID options
sample id options.description:
Options for adding the id to .obs on the MuData object. Having a sample 
id present in a requirement of several components for this pipeline.

add_id_to_obs.description: Add the value passed with --id to .obs.

add_id_obs_output.description: .Obs column to add the sample IDs to

add_id_make_observation_keys_unique.description: Join the id to the .obs index (.obs_names)

rna_min_counts.description: Minimum number of counts captured per cell.

rna_max_counts.description: Maximum number of counts captured per cell.

rna_min_genes_per_cell.description: Minimum of non-zero values per cell.

rna_max_genes_per_cell.description: Maximum of non-zero values per cell.

rna_min_cells_per_gene.description: Minimum of non-zero values per gene.

rna_min_fraction_mito.description: Minimum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial.

rna_max_fraction_mito.description: Maximum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial.

rna_min_fraction_ribo.description: Minimum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial.

rna_max_fraction_ribo.description: Maximum fraction of UMIs that are mitochondrial.

prot_min_counts.description: Minimum number of counts per cell.

prot_max_counts.description: Minimum number of counts per cell.

prot_min_proteins_per_cell.description: Minimum of non-zero values per cell.

prot_max_proteins_per_cell.description: Maximum of non-zero values per cell.

prot_min_cells_per_protein.description: Minimum of non-zero values per protein.

gdo_min_counts.description: Minimum number of counts per cell.

gdo_max_counts.description: Minimum number of counts per cell.

gdo_min_guides_per_cell.description: Minimum of non-zero values per cell.

gdo_max_guides_per_cell.description: Maximum of non-zero values per cell.

gdo_min_cells_per_guide.description: Minimum of non-zero values per guide.

highly_variable_features_var_output.description: In which .var slot to store a boolean array corresponding to the highly variable genes.

highly_variable_features_obs_batch_key.description: If specified, highly-variable genes are selected within each batch separately and merged

var_gene_names.description:
.var column name to be used to detect mitochondrial/ribosomal genes instead of .var_names (default if not set).
Gene names matching with the regex value from --mitochondrial_gene_regex or --ribosomal_gene_regex will be 
identified as mitochondrial or ribosomal genes, respectively

var_name_mitochondrial_genes.description: In which .var slot to store a boolean array corresponding the mitochondrial genes.

obs_name_mitochondrial_fraction.description:
When specified, write the fraction of counts originating from mitochondrial genes 
(based on --mitochondrial_gene_regex) to an .obs column with the specified name.
Requires --var_name_mitochondrial_genes.

mitochondrial_gene_regex.description:
Regex string that identifies mitochondrial genes from --var_gene_names.
By default will detect human and mouse mitochondrial genes from a gene symbol.

var_name_ribosomal_genes.description: In which .var slot to store a boolean array corresponding the ribosomal genes.

obs_name_ribosomal_fraction.description:
When specified, write the fraction of counts originating from ribosomal genes 
(based on --ribosomal_gene_regex) to an .obs column with the specified name.
Requires --var_name_ribosomal_genes.

ribosomal_gene_regex.description:
Regex string that identifies ribosomal genes from --var_gene_names.
By default will detect human and mouse ribosomal genes from a gene symbol.

var_qc_metrics.description:
Keys to select a boolean (containing only True or False) column from .var.
For each cell, calculate the proportion of total values for genes which are labeled 'True', 
compared to the total sum of the values for all genes

top_n_vars.description:
Number of top vars to be used to calculate cumulative proportions.
If not specified, proportions are not calculated

pca_overwrite.description: Allow overwriting slots for PCA output.

clr_axis.description: Axis to perform the CLR transformation on.

rna scaling options.title: RNA Scaling options
rna scaling options.description:
Options for enabling scaling of the log-normalized data to unit variance and zero mean.
The scaled data will be output a different layer and representation with reduced dimensions
will be created and stored in addition to the non-scaled data.

rna_enable_scaling.description: Enable scaling for the RNA modality.

rna_scaling_output_layer.description: Output layer where the scaled log-normalized data will be stored.

rna_scaling_pca_obsm_output.description:
Name of the .obsm key where the PCA representation of the log-normalized
and scaled data is stored.

rna_scaling_pca_loadings_varm_output.description:
Name of the .varm key where the PCA loadings of the log-normalized and scaled
data is stored.

rna_scaling_pca_variance_uns_output.description:
Name of the .uns key where the variance and variance ratio will be stored as a map.
The map will contain two keys: variance and variance_ratio respectively.

rna_scaling_umap_obsm_output.description: Name of the .obsm key where the UMAP representation of the log-normalized and scaled data is stored.

rna_scaling_max_value.description: Clip (truncate) data to this value after scaling

rna_scaling_zero_center.description: If set, omit zero-centering variables, which allows to handle sparse input efficiently."

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.
